intro: Anthospermum isaloense, commonly known as the Isalo starling or Isalo star-grass, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in the dry, rocky habitats of the Isalo National Park region. Due to its limited distribution and unique ecological role, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
